div.p:
alas vertue is well neere banished, vice hath almost gotten the vpper hand, wisdome is derided of fooks, and the seeming-wise approue themselues to be witlesse, by their heedlesse courses, for Exitus acta probat: the end trieth the truth of the matter, & the rash conceipts of yong vnripe heads, are comptrouled by the approued experience of riper iudgments. Many are the excelent precepts which the works of the learned afford, and not few also are the idle fancies of vaine and witlesse heads. The latter sort men much hunt after whereby they increase their follies, but the former sor • is much neglected whereby wisdomes reputatition is not a little impaired. Let there be by stealth, or any other vnlawfull meanes, any idle Pamphlet, stuffed with more then villany, set to sale (to corrupt vertuous minds) and it shall not want vtterance, for Nitimur in
vetitū semper cupimusque negat • , But let there be many excellēt bookes of much worth, cōpiled, (if duly regarded) yet if some, more then extraordinary matter be not therein cōtained, they may hap to lye by the walls. The consideration wherof might easily discourage many good men from paines taking in that kinde, & terrifie those who vndertake the publishing therof, from aduenturing so far in a matter likely to proue so little to their aduantage. But yet hoping that the approued sayings and experimented sentences of the worthy authors herein contained, will be some stay vnto rash-headed folly, and yeeld some content vnto wisdoms louers, in the perusall hereof: as the Authour hath bestowed his paines in colecting hereof, so haue I aduentured the Charges in Printing hereof, being hereunto the better incouraged by reason of the good
successe that this authors former booke entituled The sorowfull Soules solace, or Teares of true repentance, shed for sinne: hath already obtayned at his readers hands: Thus gentle reader wishing that thou maiest gaine double as much pleasure in perusing hereof, as the author did paynes in collecting hereof, I rest thy friend and well-willer.
